Review: If you are on business in the area then its a great hotel, but not great for a family vacation or kids. The hotel feels like a local target and is not connected to any good shopping or dinning outside the hotel. The pool and facilities are excellent (although why not fix the fountains?) and the breakfast buffet is world class, but the rooms are just average at best.

The security is over the top with a general atmosphere of a bunch of stiffs. Not a hotel for kids (pool closes to kids at 7pm, unless Chinese). Room service is way over priced, but the breakfast buffet is worth the stay itself, with a world class buffet. Pool and recreation areas are nice and clean, but the rooms are carpeted (mine was wet when we arrived) and bathrooms dated... at best average rooms. Security is very heavy, but not effective when I found a hotel daily report in my newspaper that had VIP lists and their rooms, as well as hotel room 'issues' among other things... Hotel is in a part of old Davao at its heart, but not a hotel with any good walking areas nearby... unless one is with locals and likes street food.
Checking in is on the slow side, have to wait for more than an hour for an extra bed
I think it's good hotel in Davao. But level of hotel is avarage. It's too long waitnig to get taxi. About 30min?? Next time i try to stay other hotels.

My husband and I annually travel to Davao to visit friends and enjoy the culture. And we always stay at Marco Polo. Service is exceptional, staff are nice & friendly, and buffet breakfast is fresh and delicious. We always feel at home, the location is close to shopping, taxis are always available and walking around the hotel is fun. I strongly recommend Marco Polo Davao to my friends and family.
Great View. Great Staff. Everything is Great.
The place is ideal as it has all of what to expect in a nice hotel. Swimming pool, fitness center, Etc. The breakfast buffet is great
Hotel is located in the center of the city. Security is strict. Good pool. Friendly staff. But the room bed, tv, and everything else is old. The bathroom also. It needs renovation. ASAP.
Those in charge of reception/check-in/check-out are slow. Everything else in the hotel — excellent

I've chosen to stay at Marco Polo Hotel Davao for its convenient location for my work. But the hotel and it's facilities has deteriorated. The lunch and breakfast buffet was ordinary. The room is old. The curtains have holes. The curtains are not blacked-out so it's hard to sleep, with lights coming in. Too many small lights inside the room also: from the TV, cable, fire alarm and internet. It's difficult to mix the hot and cold water at the sink. Didn't see any bidet. No free newspaper, No welcome fruit, being in the land of fruits. Security is very intimidating. Stricter than the airport! No interesting places around it. Not even Aldivicno is good for shopping anymore. No, I will not book at this hotel again.
Very Good Location. Breakfast impressive.

The hotel is very good and the personal is very kind. Especially the reception personals are incredible. I had arrivied at 2 am and after long flight I was very tired. Moreover, taking into consideration that my bag was lost (it was delivered the day after) you can imagine my situation. They immediately arranged my accomodation. Next time my choose will be again Marco Polo. The breakfast is very good. I recommed choose it also along with accomodation.
I enjoyed my stay at the Marco Polo hotel and I will stay here on my next visit to Davao . Excellent staff and service .

I don't really understand on why luxury hotels will put prices up-front but at the end you will have additional hidden charges. What was more upsetting was that I have communicated with hotel reservation on making our stay more special as it was our wedding anniversary, then they said that they'll request for a cake but somehow when we have checked-in, no cake was found. Lastly, the food was not that good. We ate on their restaurant near the pool side and breakfast buffet. But to be fair with them, the staff were superb.
The place is a bit old, the breakfast was not that good
room a little bit old and dusty and need a total renovation coz the room and facility is not worth for a 5* hotel.

My recent stay in this hotel is a beautiful experience and it is indeed a good decision to book again. Have stayed with Marco Polo in my prior company and returning with the same excellent service and very accommodating and friendly staff is pure happiness. I felt I was on vacation even if this is a business trip. My needs are attended to. I left my camera and nothing get lost. It is the people and the service and I think this is the cutting edge of Marco Polo Davao.Will be glad to return again.
Very good hotel. good friendly staff. security was utmost. Old but well kept. Definitely will be my choice for future trips into Davao.
Another good stay at Marco Polo Davao. Room was very noisy due to connecting door which does not stop sound coming from adjoining room. Good breakfast
Center of the city, accessible to the mall and shopping areas, restaurants. Good service , clean room, sheets and towels
Centrally located and near shopping area. Clean rooms and bed sheets, nice bathroom, but shower has small water coming out
every one so nice and patient

During my last visit I stayed at the Marco Polo Hotel. I found this hotel to be very pleasant, the staff are very friendly and the hotel itself is very clean. Hotel staff are very responsive when requests are made, and the security is thorough. Overall, the experience was better than I expected, and I'd definitely stay at this hotel during my next visit to Davao.

We have been regular customers of this hotel but no more. The service has been detreating over the last year or so. The final straw was my wife's last visit, when she was refused breakfast if she did not pay, even though the booking clearly stated breakfast was included. She complained but was basically brushed off. On checking out, she complained and the staff said she should have had breakfast but offered no kind of discount or refund. I advise anyone going to Davao to avoid Marco Polo and go to Bondi & Bourke, which is a much nicer hotel and the breakfast is superb.

Great check in, and check out Comfortable room good views Pleasent staff. Good selection of buffet foods Staff are a bit thin on the ground and your head waiter/food service guy needs a bit of a kicking, ask him to watch you tube videos on how to clear tables in Italian or French restaurant/Hotels in France and Italy so that staff becomes proficient to international standards rather than local standard.
Centrally located, stone throw away from Roxas night market.

I have flight delay which make me arrive at your hotel at 3/4am on Apr 16. I have booked 2 nights in this hotel (check in Apr 15 and check out on Apr 17). The hotel booking for Apr 15 is already confirmed and paid. When I arrived hotel and simply want a bed to rest as I was so tired. However, the check in staff told me that my booking was cancelled (which I didn't). Even though I have showed my hotel confirmation and confirmed with booking agent that my booking is valid, they made me wait and requested me to pay for extra me for early check in for Apr 16, which is definitely unacceptable as I did pay my room on Apr 15. The poor management of this hotel made me feel negative on this hotel especially I was so tired after long hour flight delay but they still charged me for early check in on Apr 16 3/4am!

I have flight delay which make me arrive at your hotel at 3/4am on Apr 16. I have booked 2 nights in this hotel (check in Apr 15 and check out on Apr 17). The hotel booking for Apr 15 is already confirmed and paid. When I arrived hotel and simply want a bed to rest as I was so tired. However, the check in staff told me that my booking was cancelled (which I didn't). Even though I have showed my hotel confirmation and confirmed with booking agent that my booking is valid, they made me wait and requested me to pay for extra me for early check in for Apr 16, which is definitely unacceptable as I did pay my room on Apr 15. The poor management of this hotel made me feel negative on this hotel especially I was so tired after long hour flight delay but they still charged me for early check in on Apr 16 3/4am!
nice location,nice hotel ,nice room,nice breakfast
I can tell that the safety of their guests is their top priority and this is what I like most.

The Marco Polo hotel is conveniently located in Davao city. It's about 30 minutes from the airport but located in downtown. Some rooms are remodeled and some rooms look a bit worn out but it has always been clean when we visited. They also have a very tight security system which gives peace of mind to those staying here.

The downstairs lounge is very cozy. Price of drinks and snacks are reasonable. Staff is helpful and friendly, and informative.Sheets and pillows are soft and conducive for a restful sleep. They need to provide washcloths.

I stayed for a one-night staycation with my son. I love the comfort and luxury we felt there, and that it was near popular spots so we only had to walk or take a jeepney to get around. My son and I like going on staycations but normally on a smaller budget; we only splurged this time to try something new. But it was worth it!
Very good location I ask the bellboy to buy me some pomelo and it was not that good.
MArco Polo is always a dependable choice when in Davao. Accessible to many parts of the city. Staff are always topnotch.
Pros: Good location, friendly staff Cons: No power plug near the bed. WiFi signal is really poor.
Definitely going back here in my next vacation.
This hotel is very near to several local banks, so no worry if you are ran out of cash :) . Night market is also available from 5pm onwards.

Booked a premier room and gave us a deluxe room. Had to inform the front desk and had us move to the room we booked. Location of the hotel within the city was very good, easy access to transportation and shops nearby. Food served in the cafe, chinese restaurant, in-room dinning and lobby lounge was fair and aptly priced. The hotel staff moved fast, very polite and service was satisfactory. The main building is a bit old, rooms are large, the beds comfy but bathroom towels need to be changed, ours had holes in them. I expected more from this type of hotel. Chairs in the room need refurbishing as well, the foam cushion was sagging.

I chose this hotel because I've heard of the name before and it was one of the hotels listed by the Ironman triathlon website for the event of which I participated in Davao. While the hotel is a bit old, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. In fact, the Philippinos were all very friendly. I may stay here again for next years event
It’s an old hotel , not to say it was rundown but just not modern. Still- bed was comfy, room was clean, Food was good, service was good .
The place is in the heart of the City.
Best Breakfast! Great stay. Will book again soon.
Love Lazuli Spa excellent value for the money. Huge breakfast buffet, nice pool but wish there was a Jacuzzi. Good restaurants and room service. All staff was very accommodating and friendly.
Disappointed with the breakfast buffet rice was cold, eggs were cold.

If you're looking for a great place to stay in Davao, this is where you should be. Security is strict, check in/check out was a breeze, rooms and amenities are clean and comfortable, food is great and most of all, customer service is excellent. I'll definitely stay here again the next time I'm in Davao. Kudos!
Grandiose. The service is excellent. The breakfast buffet has lot of choices. The bed is very comfortable. It has the best location in the heart of the city. You couldn’t ask for more!
Friendly staff, nice hotel just a little old fashion

Overall well run but way too many people in a small location. Breakfast dining food was very basic. Woken up by loud event across the road, pool was very cloudy and too many people. In summary only 3 to 4 stars.

The house Security Staff kept peace, order, and safety in the hotel with a stern, and firm hand, while the house staff was graceful under fire (the hotel was busy when I checked in, and there would be one or two fat ugly Filipinas who would cut through an orderly line for the Front Desk to the silent consternation of the majority of Filipinos who were civilized enough to keep the line, and the utter embarrassment of their old white male companions.).
Nicely run hotel. Staff was professional and courteous. Good security with round the clock taxi's. Food was good although a bit expensive. Next time in Davao will stay there again.

The location is perfect, right at the heart of the city. The Aldevinco Shopping Center (for handcrafts), Roxas nightmarket, and Pasalubong Center are all within walking distance. Service is good and the concierge is always very helpful.

I stayed at this hotel on Valentines Day with my girlfriend. It has a lovely big swimming pool. Wifi works brilliantly. There are two lots of security checks before entering but maybe it is necessary in the area (staff very polite conducting the checks). As we stayed during Valentines Day the normal menu had sadly changed and for 1,500 Php a person the hotel were doing special 5 course set menus. To be honest it didnt look that great and it would have been nice if we could have ordered from the normal menu. Instead we ate at a restaurant outside.

very accommodating and friendly staff. Will get out of their way to ensure you are well taken care of. Food is fantastic in Lotus Court Chinese Restaurant. Location is near Chinatown which is bustling with fresh produce and a good shopping location.

Neighbours seemed to have 6-7 people laughing and chatting at 12:45am. Called front desk for help. No answer for 20 min. Called operator who promised to help. No help. Finally at 1:30am called front desk again, who promised to help. Still no help. No sleep till 2:30am and had to wake up at 4am for my excursion up Mt Apo. Went to spa no one at reception for over 30 mins. Went back to room to call for booking, no answer. Ended up soaking in the tub which was not ergonomically designed for relaxed position.

Pros are short the staff is amazing like anywhere in Philippines. The building is nice . other than that it is all down hill. Buffet breakfast is nothing to comment about . I rented the club room on the 18 floor very small bed. Small room . Was very disappointed we had full access to everywhere and like I said earlier nothing to comment on. Services poor. Honestly 2.5/5 for my review

marco polo never disappoints. staff friendly and accommodating, room clean spacious and cozy enough even for our meticulous toddler, food yummy (snacks were satisfying and breakfast buffet had a lot of choices). all in all, a 10!

My stay was enjoyable for the following reasons: 1. Restaurants, pool and areas surrounding them were very well kept and aesthetically pleasing. 2. Food ordered through room service arrived promptly . 3. Staff as with your other property In Ortigas was outstanding, attentive and friendly. 4. The room was good, beds comfy and the mixed pillows were awesome. With all that said npw for the challenges which made it hard for me to give a 5 star rating... 1. The clothe shower curtains smaller musty which suggests that they are not changed out and washed on a regular basis. 2. The cable service was terrible... the picture kept fuzzing in and out or would completely dissolve to black . Time did not help clear it up. 3 .I encountered 2 different juvenile roaches in the room... I'm not sure if they came in with the room service cart or were pre existing. Either implication should be seriously addressed. 4. Several minor cosmetic repairs needed throughout the property... I'm out of room

This was not my first time staying at this hotel and still thankful for this hotel's hospitality has to offer. Pool and food was main reason for my Five star review, secondly awesome rooms and staff. I would stay at Marco polo again whenever I fly to davao.
great hotel

We stayed at Marco Polo for our 8th wedding anniversary and couldn't help but notice how strict and secure we felt thanks to the hotel security personnel. Compared to other security guards we encounter at other hotels and malls, Marco Polo guards follow strict security procedures such as checking the insides of your car and the contents of your suitcase to ensure nothing gets snuck in. The hotel itself is old but has aged well. We found the room comfortable, and the hotel conveniently located around pharmacies, eateries, and banks. The bed wasn't as comfortable as we expected, but it's a minor issue. We'll definitely consider this hotel again for future trips to Davao City.

Expensive Hotel but very less quality, room is small (superior), toilet is is dirty and a little destroyed, dust on the carpet on the floor, stool is little destroyed also with the lamp, mini bar fridge is dirty, incomplete toiletries. Bad experienced. Unrecommendable. Sorry to say!

Beautiful hotel, rooms, and facilities. Very friendly staff who respond quickly to requests. After I checked in, my bathroom had no towels and it took them a while for housekeeping to bring some, which was a bit frustrating because I needed to shower after a long flight and had to rush to a meeting. Aside from this, however, I very much enjoyed my stay, the subsequent housekeeping was perfect, and I would absolutely return to this hotel next time I’m in the city.
Wonderful stay at Marco Polo! Awesome location as it was very near the night market which we totally enjoyed throughout our stay. Place and staff are very warm. We definitely enjoyed our stay :)
Never fails to give you a comfortable stay!nice room..clean bathroom..definitely a relaxing staycation!
I was given s room with 2 single beds when I booked a queen. Also no towels in room. Had to ask a couple of times to have corrected for both issues. Eventually issues were resolved.
Good
We had a great time. Attentive staff. Clean and comfortable room. No hidden charges. Safe pool for kids. Good food. We will book again via Agoda beacuse it is hassle free. :)

Room was clean and super comfy. But what really ticks me off is that its a 5star hotel but doesnt know how to accomodate a full housed saturday breakfast buffet.. me and my huaband went down for our breakfast around 840 am expecting a crowd but we didnt expect to see food not been replenished. We have to settle with hard garlic rice, sausage(that tasted spoiled), sunny side up egg and cheeses.. and we are not over reacting coz my husband went and see the food twice to check and still havent refill up yet and its alreadly atleast 40 minutes passed. And addition to this was we were not served water! We're done eating when one of the server saw that we didnt have water and served us straight away. This is the worst service of a 5star hotel that i have experience.
GOOD PLACE
very clean great staff perfect location

Very poor service in terms of service. Poor drainage both sink and bathtub No hand and face towel provided. Very exaggerated security check compared to airport security. My husband felt he’s been treated like a possible criminal rather than a client. Mind you, they will do a body search without asking your permission, nor they will give you any intructions and explanation. Car park was too much hassle, they will give you a white stub without giving you any intructions.

We booked 3 rooms.Check in was fine,Front desk was polite.Rooms was bit old need upgrades.When I booked I put that we need extra towel which is don't have.We went to the pool side bar to get some drink but they are mostly out of liqour which is we want to buy a whole bottle.Bartender was so friendly and kept telling sorry which is not his fault.Breakfast has lot of selection thumbs up for that aside from one lady I forgot her name she was rude when I asked her we need another chair.Location is good.My daughter and nephew's enjoy the pool.
Very good breakfast. Very good large bedrooms with seating area, and CR with bath.
Not all staff is nice. People relationship at the lobby lounge not good. I feel less important
Pro
Clean, Comfortable, Great Hotel.
No shower curtains inside my toilet. So if the water splashed everywhere then you can trip and fall.
Apart from lack of information when checking in about room deposit for each night you stay an breakfast cost would have been good
To many add on charges and room was small for the price. Lobby was excellent

This property is not a 5star hotel and was surprised and disappointed to see the stained carpets , broken television , and more than anything the service at this what is claiming to be a luxury hotel has on a whole a very unfriendly , tired and Blanca rly unfriendly staff, ( the pool staff at the cafe were in fact unpolished and rude )...Really not what I would expect from the Marco Polo Hotel Chain

The Hotel was comfortable, although the bathroom, had a shower In the bath with a showercurtain, the water pressure from the shower was low and the shower Rose could have done with a clean. The carpet in our Delux Room was stained. The external of the building is in need of reprinting. The rooms would benefit from a refurbishment. Having said thank, the staff were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble.
I booked 2 rooms during my stay and the rooms toilet sinks were clogging..needs maintenance ,otherwise the stay was pleasant.
We had a great time staying and sure hope will be staying here in the future. :)
everything is perfect!
Nice hotel, however, in need of renovation. The wallpaper was starting to peel off the walls and it did smell a little moldy in the hallways.

What I like most: location, convenience room service and the name. What I do not like: I asked for large bed the staff gave me 2 single bed I waited for another 5 to 10 mins. No one send us to the room, I carried my bag all along. Lacking one remote control for the tv, tried to call the front desk few times but no one is picking up. Until i called another number to assist me to maintenance. Upon checking out, I over heard another guest who was not happy also with the service because they tried to call front desk too but to no avail. To add on, prior to my arrival I emailed the hotel for few arrangements, the person keep on apologising for the delayed response.
This was my base for Mt. Apo. It was great value and had a good breakfast. Staff were helpful. I'll stay again if I go to Davao again.

The pool area, beds and other equipment such as telephones need improvement. The guards on the entrance were also uncourteous. Over-all, a bit old but still classy hotel located in the heart of the city.

People here are so great. Even after over a year away. I was recognized and felt very much at home once again. I love this place so much. This time I made even more friends with some of the employees and they made my stay here top notch. Thanks to all
I really enjoyed the breakfast and service overall. Room was nice and its better than any other hotel I've been to in the Philippines for the money.

Hi!i just book in Davao hotel last 20-21 of Dec ,2017...I arrive hotel early check in.Hotel was nice .security in hotel was good .checking all the things to be clear .Staff wasn't not enough of service ,I've seen there less guest and less staff especially in the front desk..they have long Desk table but only 2staff infront line who assist the customer while they had 6minimum of guest who will check in there but I think it's normal to have 2receptionist.but it's still too slow. Here is the scenario: i call in the reception to to assist me how to use the safety deposit box because I've seen the guide note there is chinese.so I don't understand how it work.I call in the reception through phone .she answer my call and she said she will send up someone to assist me.but waiting for 30min but no one showing up.and then I call again but still no one assist me.well!its luck of service in some ways,still not helping for me. Should provide some attention to there guest .

Marco Polo never failed to amaze me. I love Davao, but Marco Polo made me love Davao even more. The Continental Staffs were the best - Lali, Homer, Raul, Jayson - everybody. From the front desk to the waiters to my Favorite Chef. Arvin is the best person to talk to when in Marco Polo. He will always find a way to give to the best service you deserve. I am actually lost for words as I can no longer describe how special and wonderful our stay was when we there. I will forever be in love with Marco Polo Davao.

it's no secret that the marco polo is a top quality hotel. The staff are simply wonderful, polite, and hospitable. What surprises me most is the price tag. At roughly $85 a night (breakfast included) it's simply impossible to top. I love this hotel; hope I can stay again some time in the future.

Hotel is definitely 4 Star and the staff are well trained and very polite. The Cafe Marco could use a few more staff especially the receptionist who checks people in for breakfast mostly complimentary with our rooms. The lady there gets overwhelmed because not only does she police the guests coming in and out, she also has to check them in, verify their seats, then seat them. The lines to get in can get long and guests can get impatient. I know I was irritated a little because she was getting snappy with me as I was herding my group of 8 cousins in and getting them settled. Otherwise, I like the building still. The front desk service and kitchen service was good. We were there for a private family dinner event and food was satisfactory for the dinner. My family had a lot of fun, and our dinner even turned into karaoke sesh!😅 everybody was happy. Save for 2 more rooms, we had the rest of the entire 5th floor. A security personnel came to check after hours at 10 pm to do routine check.

Located at the heart of the city, Marco Polo is very convenient place to stay. Security is topnotch. My room was upgraded to Superior, very spacious and conducive for work, very fast internet. Offers variety of cuisines even at breakfast, delicious and worth it. Visited during Christmas season and it was a plus to see the beautiful decorations which added to the classy ambiance that the hotel brings.

We stayed here last month and the place is very nice. The breakfast buffet way above and beyond what we were expecting... very good! The location is very good too. The hotel is conveniently located near the night market and the souvenir shops. So basically we enjoyed our weekend here BUT upon checking out, we were charged with stuff from the minibar. And not only that, when the front desk called to ask the housekeeping if the room was cleared for check out, they said yes. They didn’t mention that my nephew left something. When my nephew realized that he had left something in the room, the housekeeping staff said they didn’t find anything. My dad had to go back to the room and find it himself. And only to find out one of the staff found it. I would have rated this place 5* if the staff were more honest.
Better services than before...this will be my home!

I’ve been with this hotel everytime I visit Davao. The staff at the continental club has been so kind to provide me with the things I need. I really appreciated your effirt in doing so! Love the place ....next time it will be my home!

What I love about this hotel is the buffet breakfast, that's why we always opt to stay at this hotel plus it is just across the pasalubong centre. I think this is our 6th stay at this hotel. I just wanted to say that we were somewhat disappointed about the service this time. Our check-in went well, we actually arrived in the afternoon. But we were surprised that our rooms did not have towels. When we raised their attention towards this matter, they said that not all the towels are dry that's why. That should not be the case. Any hotel should have more than enough towel to supply the existing guest and the ones who just checked in.

We stayed here for a wedding event. In general, Marco Polo Davao delivered although it has some kinks which needs to be worked on. I saw 2 small cockroaches in the room we stayed in. Then the bathtub is a little tarnished already and may need to be considered for replacement. As for the service, it was topnotch. When I called housekeeping for some request, they promptly delivered the items. The check-in/ check-out process is straightforward as long as the booking is confirmed and correct. The location is also a plus if your purpose in Davao is in the city, as the property is located in a prime spot.

My son got an accident in the swimming pool and their nurse had helped us and assist us all the way to the nearest hospital davao doc. They also waited for us in the hospital and send us back to the hotel..indeed they are true to their service commitment and the hotel is child friendly. We will definitely come back to celebrate again the birthday of my kids!!!
nice location for a hotel in the heart of the city. Friendly and polite staff
Comfortable room, clean. Good breakfast choices.
We had a great time staying here at Marco Polo. They gave us nice and upgraded room. Breakfast is superb, there’s a lot of choices. Fast wifi in our room. Surely will be back at this hotel.
I LOVE YOU AGODA! YOURE THE BEST ONLINE BOOKING OF HOTELS EVER! VERY VERY FAST AND EASY! LESS HASSLE :*
We come back to Marco Polo end this month.
ACTUALLY I BOOKED IN OTHER HOTEL NEAR TO OUR CONVENTION AREA SMX LANANG, BUT I TRANSFERRED TO MARCO POLO, I'TS SO RELAXING. MY HOBBY IS STAYCATION.
the hotel clearly needs to upgrade some of its facilities. also, we were sad that the kids pool was not separated from the adults pool
The location was very accessible. The place is so secured. The facilities and rooms are clean and comfy. Breakfast is okay. :)

I am so thankful to the staff at the reception, we arrived at 7am and my son is not feeling well, I asked them if they can allow us for early check in, im so glad they accomodated my request asap and found a room. They did not charged us for early checked in. They are all awesome, superb customer service.

Consistently a good chain. Marco Polo keep up your excellent customer service from the airport, driver, arrival, check-in process, and hotel porter. Marco Polo Davao you impressed me and its good to hear you are looking after your employees too so well.
Excellent reception and concierge staff. I ask for 30 minutes extension of our stay and they easily said yes. They can accommodate your request easily. Thank you for the great stay.

Location is at the centre of the city. Marco Polo Hotel itself is a landmark in Davao. The rooms are huge, nice bed, has table if you want to work in the room. Toilet has a bathtub, hot and cold shower, toiletries, hairdryer. It has safe for your jewellery, documents and other expensive stuff. It has a swimming pool too. The buffet breakfast has a very good Filipino and international food selections.
reservation was upgraded to suite. but key card was not functioning well on the upgraded room. we ended up waiting for staff to open the room for around 5-10 minutes... twice.
The location is very convenient when you want to go shopping and street food night market Staff are very helpfull,freindly and very welcoming.

I booking for a single bed but it have a twin and I am ok with that because the hotel will be the one who decide but the thing that I do not feel ok is I tell the reception to prepare me a extra bed, check - in 11:00 pm and wait until 2:30 am. nothing is happen. I tell to one time to the check - in counter and to the one who deliver my suitcase to my room. it means you do not take care your guess well.
The hotel has been here for several years but it doesn't show it. No foul smells and all amenities are in good working order. Food at the cafe is great and ambiance is fine.
Staff are honest enough to return my sunglasses left behind at the front desk.

I would like to commend them for accommodating our request for early check in around 12NN; staff are friendly and courteous. Well maintained building and hats off to their security procedure/system. Remarkable. Our booking is just wrong timing coz the entire pool area is closed till midnight bcoz of a debut party but all OK bcoz we were still able to access Lazuli Spa, one of their signature amenities. Therapists are well trained, accommodating and friendly... facilities & amenities are all well maintained, we even have our own sauna room inside the couples room. Food at "The Lobby" is a bit pricey for the quality. Since breakfast buffet is not included with our booking, the front desk officer offered a promo that if we'll avail it upon check in, we can get it for 500/head instead of regular rate of 750/head.. we immediately said "yes" and told her to just charge it to our account. Unfortunately, we found out the next morning that only one breakfast was tagged for us, as per the restaurant staff, there are times that their system is malfunctioning in tagging notes/request of the guests. But she was able to fix it and give us discounted rate for 2 heads. They are one of the best breakfast buffets we've tried so far, has a wide selection from appetizer/starters, viands, breads, cheese, drinks, eggs, dessert.. Generally speaking, we enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back again soon :)
Buffet breakfast was great. Child-friendly pool. Friendly staff.
Clean room and the staff are very accomodating!
Hotel is fine but the front office staff is not friendly specially the conceige staff at the time we check out waiting for shuttle services gave strange look. Otherwise fine with us

how the hotel is , is because of its people. the staff are excellent. make you stay enjoyable . congratulations to all of you. i highly recommend to tourists and filipinos alike. you will feel safe and well taken cared of.

No complaints at all about the Marco Polo in Davao; it is literally right in the middle of the city and everything you need is close. Restaurants in the hotel is a little expensive but not too bad. What I like most was their fitness center in the hotel. By far the best I have seen.

Was pleasantly surprised about the hotel- i thought that it would be dated and not well maintained, but it's actually really well kept, had strict security and had great service. Plus it's at a great location: night street market is just directly across!
the location is near the city its easy to explore and staff are friendly

Stayed here for business for 4 nights. Check in at 1400hrs hotel check in time. The room was supposed to be ready. Upon taking a shower, notice that there is no towel in the bathroom. Called 3 times for towel and it tooks more than 30 minutes to arrive. Complaint to the duty manager, but it seems he doesnt know how to handle the claim. Will never stay here for the future
Service is good. Breakfast wide spread
The Marco Polo Davao is centrally located in the middle of the city; this hotel has everything you could ask for at a fair price. Definitely will be coming back to this location.

value for our money was worth it. when it comes to the amenities but when it came for the food especially for the breakfast buffet (which we really had a very high expectation) it was out par with the buffet offered from waterfront. but i would still say that we really had a good time staying in marco polo. 😊😊😊

I have stayed here on a few occasions. There are very few decent hotels in Davao and this is the best one I could find. It is a bit dated and in need of a refurbishment but still has character and comfortable. The staff are the best I have encountered anywhere and the owners should be very happy to have such good staff. The only let down is the food. The breakfast is not bad and a large selection but that's as good as it gets. The Bistro and restaurant are in desperate need of an international chef who does not come from the Philippines. I say this because Philippines food is about as bad as it gets. Bland, tasteless, boring slop and it really lets the country down. You will not get a decent meal in Davao, ever, or the Philippines for that matter (although I have not tried Manila yet. But I digress, the hotel is good and I would still recommend it in spite of the terrible food.
within the city area...good location...good customer service the staff are so friendly...good stay.
it's our home away from home in the Phiippines
This is our favorite place to stay in the world!
Will definitely go back!

The location is very good, it's just a few meters away from the famous Roxas Night Market where the best bbq are found. The security is top notch! Food is great, I love cheese, and they have various kinds of cheese on their buffet. The staff in their Continental floor are very warm and very very accommodating. I love Lali so much - she knew how I wanted my coffee. Our waiter (sorry forgot his name) was also very very kind, and he knew how we wanted our eggs done. Housekeeping is also great, they provided us with all our needs. The Hotel may not be as New as compared with other Manila hotels, but it made me (and my family) feel at home and well taken cared of. The Duty Manager Arvin is also very very accommodating. He helped me when my key did not work, and provided us with everything we need. I only have positive words for Marco Polo, and we will definitely go back.
Marco Polo keep up their status as a five star hotel in Davao City....We had a wonderful stay ....
convenient, clean and a friendly staff. The food buffet was quite pleasant for breakfast
Location is good Service is very good -facilities are well maintained
The CSR in charge went the extra mile to satisfy me for me disappointment (linens need updating) and attention to detail on hygiene is not up to standard (professional hotel management ISO reviewer)
Perfect for our staycation!!! Theres pool, gym, spa, bar... everything we need when we want to enjoy our hometown...
Experienced an earthquake and staff were on call. Good hotel.

Booked 2 rooms but the hotel management only gave 2 breakfast included for 2 persons(1 room) which was totally absurd since the number of people booked were just 2 persons for 2 rooms. It was a mistake but the hotel could have given the breakfast for 4 people instead of just 2 since the booked rooms were 2. Totally disappointing! No given consideration even they knew already from the emails with the reservation that there are 4 people.
Very good service. Helpful staff. VG Gym and VG Breakfast
accessible to any transportation. it is also near the restaurants and great amenities. surely will come back.
excellent stay worth the pay!
Probably the best hotel in Davao
just like the ambiance

Our family is from North Cotabato and we used to checked in on various hotels at Davao after our flight arrival from mnl or bcd. Along with our baby, he slept so well at his comfortable and clean baby cot. when we tried at another known hotel, we are surprised the cot is dirty, looks so old and metal. we cant even trust to put our baby and keeps on crying. Unlike at Marco Polo, our family had a perfect stay and our baby loves the place because it was fully decorated and can feel the ambiance of Christmas. It is also our wedding anniversary so they prepared a complimentary cake for us. we will definitely stay here again.
Everything was excellent!

The hotel looks dirty. carpets and couches could do with a good wash. Hotel and rooms smell like cigarette smoke. It doesnt feel luxurious as a 5 star hotel. Concrete surrounding pool could do with a waterblast to lift its colour. Staff were however great!!! Security at the door seems tight. Food excellent! We are a family of four from overseas, 2 teenagers.
Booking through Agoda does not get you the best or renovated room.

Unbelievable, they say that this is the best in Davao that’s why I booked a 3 nights stay but I was disappointed. The hotel is old with stained carpets. Poor air conditioning system with really old furniture… and the staff at the front desk was really disappointing. It took me so long to check out and I almost missed my flight. It is either they are stupid or they are crooks. They charge against my 3,000 deposit P2,780 but they cannot explain where I spent it. I even have a receipt of my breakfast charges for the kids amounting to 1,500 only. They recomputed over and over again and finally my bill was reduced to 1, 748.17 for the kid’s breakfast. They insisted on this amount and said that the rate in the front desk is different from the rate in their Marco Polo Café. Seriously? How could that be? And besides I showed them my receipt of only P750 pesos per day for 2 days. I don’t have time to argue because I will miss my flight but I have to warn the future guests to check your bill carefully or you will be a victim of their stupidity or scam? And by the way, my hotel package include airport transfer. They pick us up when we arrived at 11:15pm and I was grateful but when I arrange a transport back to the airport at 10pm they said that their transport service is up to 7pm only. So many inconsistencies. What’s wrong with these people? The 2 male Front desk on duty of June 26, 2017 you are a disappointment to Davao. I went there to experience the beautiful things that I heard about Davao and yes I did find it beautiful and peaceful except that it ended in disappointment because of my Marco Polo hotel experience. I planned to return more to Davao but not to your hotel anymore.
Still my favorite hotel in Davao

The room is quite big i love the location so close to the nearest mall . The guard of the hotel is so strict, they checks the bags properly so that nobody can allow to bring harm weapons inside the hotel. nice but one thing i dont like in this hotel is the shower.
Good value for money
Very clean and perfect service
Accessible to the malls, staff were polite and very helpful. Food was great.

Overall, a very nice place to stay. Has the biggest, best pool of any hotel I have been to in Davao. My only complaints would be that the food is a bit substandard for the prices charged, and the plumbing fixtures should be updated.
we were upgrade to suite room. buffet breakfast exceptionally ok, w food variety of choices but parking will be a problem if there is an event

The room that we got is old and the furniture are not well maintained. The bathroom is not that clean. I will not book in this hotel again. One thing that I think is good is the security when you enter. Other than that, nothing special.
its a nice hotel..nice staff, nice breakfast. but the bar close at 1 am (As rule) also no night life near the hotel .
Very courteous and helpful staff
Food smelling in corridores , and furniture is old

The first day when I arrived there were no towels in my room and I had to wait an hour and half for them. The second day I worked out at the gym and went Into the sauna and there was cockroaches in There. The third day there was smoke in my room and hallway

Except for the dated drapes, our stay was very nice, the service prompt.
I thought that my reservation included breakfast, but as it turn out, it didn't. The hotel was so accommodating that when I asked if I could pay for breakfast, management agreed without a fuzz.

This is a wonderful example of how a hotel should be run. Old style standards, quality fittings and workmanship, auperb staff. This hotel would have a place among the best in any city in the world and is certainly the best by far in Davao having stayes at the other "quality" chain hotel in the city.
Breakfast was great, felt safe through out our stay. The only thing is our room was on the 10th floor and there was a bad odor in the hall.

If you compare the quality of Marco Polo Davao to the one in Ortigas, Metro Manila, you probably will agree with me that this hotel needs a lot of fixing. Marco Polo Davao is severe shape and their management should start fixing all of it. Easy way is they should stay in Marco Polo Ortigas and see what a Marco Polo quality should look like.

I love my stay there will definitely come there to a wedding in January 2018 . Pool side personel was so friendly. Borj and Adam especially . Check in so flexible. Thanks a lot all of you . My mother in law funeral is never easy. You made it easier thanks

Third visit for me. The hotel looks tired and weary but it still have a five star status until 2018 then maybe the hotel has to reapply for its star rating. Their breakfast still amazes me. Well laid out breakfast area, food is tremendous and selections are awesome. Will use this hotel again. Staff are so respectful, friendly, and nothing is a problem when you request for something.
the other single bed in the room was well below par. very disappointed. otherwise, the buffet was well deserved for recommendation.

This hotel lived up to expectations. The staff are all very friendly and extremely helpful. The food also was excellent. The buffet restaurant has great variety of tasty dishes both Filipino and international. The amount of security was very high which really made us feel safe during our stay. Pool facility was very nice as well. The rooms are well equipped and very good size but we unfortunately encountered a cockroach in the closet. They sent someone to spray but we just didn't open the closet the rest of our stay. This was the only blemish in an otherwise great stay. I would definitely recommend staying here when in Davao.

The hotel is situated in downtown Davao, Just across Ateneo de Davao University & the famous "Roxas Night Market", Madrazo Fruit Stand is just walks away. City Hall, People's Park, Aldevinco Shopping Center & Gmall is just within 1.5 km radius
need to improve buffet
We enjoyed our stay and will definitely go back, thank you marco polo davao

Definitely gonna come back in this hotel . Good food and good location . They have tight security upon entering the hotel which is good that you know you're safe! Good staff as well !

one for the books!!! we would be happy to go back for sure!! :)

i really love this hotel.. surprisingly staff is awesome.. when i get back here and eat breakfast buffet surprisingly some staff remember me.. so if i will be in davao this hotel will be my first choice..

One thing struck me when we entered the Marco Polo Hotel is the three (3) security check we went through. Security is thorough: metal detectors, K-9, and manual checks. After security check, everything was great. Staff are cordial and helpful. Place is spotless. Food is heavenly. Kudos Marco Polo!
love the pool and amazing breakfast

Always feel at home in Marco Polo. Just feeling bad with hotels in Davao city of their "no durian, no marang inside the hotel" such an ironic policy. The city is known for these products and the hotel can't cater them?
hotel itself was clean and organized with friendly and accomodating staff plus the food was good. Overall recommending to others.

This hotel is located in a very convenient central location, there're plenty places to eat nearby, no major shopping center though, there's night market just in front the hotel. Overall a not bad hotel.

Great to have enjoyed Marco Polo's hospitality again after several years; clean, comfortable and cold aircon room was a respite from very warm outdoor weather; buffet breakfast was filling and has everything to meet everyone's desire; security was excellent so no problem there; overall, a great stay in Davao and at Marco Polo

The only reason I stay at this hotel is the location. The President also typically stays at this hotel. Many of the gym equipment is from 5+ years ago and does not work. Some equipment is 10yrs old. The bike I use never works appropriately. The pool is nice. They also have a sauna which typically works. Some of the rooms have been renovated and others have not. You need to ask for a renovated room. The breakfast is minimal. This hotel almost has a similar lobby set up to Shang but I would call it a D rated shang. Some of the rooms have a pool view which is nice. The room I stayed in was called a cabana room. It was hardly anything like a cabana. But it did have a pool view.
Hot water in the shower, a simple thing but one that many hotels can't supply here. So a plus on this one.
the hotel is quite old and needs some refurbishing but in totality my stay is "A" OK

Good location (especially toward Ateneo university), Good room, and Good In room dining menu!

This place is simply great.

Their dinner buffet was great. And the server was impressive. Thank you for the good service. Housekeeping forgot the towels in our room. And some tv channels didn't work.

Ok

The view from our premier room was amazing! The staff are outstanding and it felt like we had a very personal service. The security to enter the premises is high but at no time do you feel intimidated. The food was excellent and the room/hotel services were very reasonably priced. The only negative things would be that the shower pressure isn't great and the non-premier rooms have very dated furniture. This maybe one of the best hotels in Davao but I'm not sure I would call it a true 5 star hotel. Overall great accommodation and highly recommended.

Given that this is one of the two most popular high-end downtown hotel, the expectations were high. The furniture of the room we stayed in, looked a bit worn and a water faucet in the bathroom leaked. Other than that everything was good: comfy bed, superb aircon (finely controllable and not pointing to the bed [!]), good facilities, excellent breakfast buffet. Overall, an enjoyable stay.
Located right in the heart of the city, friendly staff, good food, superb ambiance for meetings, and put safety and security of their guest a priority.
.. superb service.. my family is really happy for its their first time to stay in a grade A hotel.. would love to be back again..
..superb service.. got lucky to be upgraded to an executive suite free.. wanna stay again if back in davao..

Although I had some concerns about the security given the recent terrorist bombing on 2 September very close to the Marco Polo, the security from the time we arrived to the time we left, was very effective and efficient. The staff are fantastic - so wonderfully friendly and very professional. My mother and I love the Marco Polo all round - in addition to the fantastic staff, the delicious food, the reasonably priced wine and the delicious fresh mango daiquiris made by Lawrence and the very comfortable and well appointed bedroom, the location of the hotel is great.

Good location, there is just a pearl and souvnir market beside hotel. Staff and consierge is very helpful. Good memory here. Facility is very old to be improve.

It's an old school hotel but very well maintained. The location is super central and staff excellent. There are some minor improvement for me: (1) Hotel Lobby is filled with Pungent Rose Scent. This triggers allergic reaction for people with fragrance allergy because it is just too strong. I dread and die every time I have to pass by the lobby. (2) Massage at PHP1100 is too expensive for very inexperienced therapists. Please send them to training. It is very disappointing. We are group of 3 people and every single one of us felt the price paid is not worth the service provided. (3) Pool Need to be cleaned more. The water is too foggy and we got itchy coming out of the pool.

Great stay at the Marco Polo. We had a premier room on a high floor with a fantastic view of the Davao gulf. The breakfast was excellent and the staff in the restaurant and at the room very friendly and accommodating. Only at the pool area the service was a bit dissappointing: very slow in bringing the drinks but also in clearing out plates and glasses from former guests and in cleaning and tidying the area. But otherwise great and definitely recommended!

Great smoggiest board breakfast. Love the omelette & sweet marinated pork. Clean upmarket hotel - with good inclusions in the room - slept very well - comfy bed and bed-linen and especially the pillows. Close to 7-11 for snacks and great street BBQ food on the next corner. Good AC too.

Overall we are disappointed of our stay in this hotel. We arrived about 11pm and the staff explained us that they are short of rooms and tried ti downgrade our room. After a complain and even scandal they found us a roon from the same class (premier room) but with city view (noisy). The filter of the aircon maybe was not changed since they installed initially because the roon was smelling very bad. Same evening i got an asthma attack. In the following morning after a new complain the changed the roon but what a surprise: there was no warm water in the shower. Again complain. They sent us a technician. He fixed the water heater. The hotel is pretending to be 5 star luxury hotel but it is very bad maintained, it's not very clean and the bad smell starts even from the lobby. If there is an alternative, better avoid this hotel.

One of the furnitures in our room was defective. I Guess it's time for them to upgrade it. Toilet lock was not working. Food at cafe Marco is not that fantastic. However, this hotel is not bad, The staff were very attentive and helpful.

Stay here for 4 nights in room 1203 , nice room , lovely view of the city and mount apo , this hotel is as good as it gets in Davao , breakfast is good with a very wide choice , the lobby and swimming pool cafes are both good too , The Lotus chinese restaurant was a letdown , no belly or roast pork , none in a chinese restaurant , we got suckling pork , more crackling then pork , ordered ice cream with 2 scoops , one strawberry and one vinilla and got 2 orders with 2 scoops each , so my wife had the other rather then cause a fuss , so avoid this restaurant as the rest of the hotel from stall everything else is fine . We did get power cuts and back up power was restored right away except once when it took 10 mins , my wife was in the lift with my 1 year old daughter but they got down and i was about to get in when the power cut took place so i was spared 10 mins in a lift , but others were not so lucky , 10 mins is not acceptable and reasons why needs to be looked at , I will stay again as the problems are only minor but need attention

Another good stay at Marco Polo, Good staff and good hotel. Only one bad thing, and this is every night, I stayed there 15 nights this time and 12 nights last year. Same thing. The pool side dining resto closes its kitchen at 930 pm a full 30 minutes before the advertised closing time of 10PM. They did it every night of our stay. The pool side staff is not good and after some nights I never ate there again. I just ordered from Cafe Marco on the 2nd floor, good food and good staff there. Overall very good hotel and I will return. Very friendly front desk and friendly staff overall.
